solution_line_template: If the bus takes {bus_trip_time} minutes to complete 80 miles of a trip, Amanda's car, which takes {car_time_fewer_minutes} fewer minutes to complete a trip than the bus, will take {bus_trip_time}-{car_time_fewer_minutes}=<<{bus_trip_time}-{car_time_fewer_minutes}={car_one_way_time}>>{car_one_way_time} minutes to complete the trip.
A round trip will take the car twice the time for going one way, a total of {car_one_way_time}+{car_one_way_time}=<<{car_one_way_time}+{car_one_way_time}={car_round_trip_time}>>{car_round_trip_time}
